issues.description: Interface name mismatch for the 'milkable' capability: the problem statement and template refer to an interface named 'Milkable' (UML and Main.java comments), but the solution implementation defines and uses an interface named 'Dairy' (Dairy.java) while leaving a Milkable.java file empty. This creates a cross-artifact type/name inconsistency: students following the problem statement would implement 'Milkable', yet the reference solution's classes (Seal, Goat) implement 'Dairy'. The presence of an empty Milkable.java in the solution repository further confuses which interface is authoritative.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the interface name consistent across all artifacts. Either (A) rename the solution's Dairy interface to Milkable and update Goat and Seal to implement Milkable, and remove/replace the empty Milkable.java file; or (B) update the problem statement and template references to use the name Dairy instead of Milkable. Ensure the interface file defines the required method signature 'String messageOnMilk();' and that all classes and comments reference the same interface name.

issues.description: The problem statement and template refer to an interface named 'Milkable' (with method messageOnMilk()), but the solution implementation introduces an interface named 'Dairy' and has Goat and Seal implement 'Dairy' instead of 'Milkable'. This inconsistent identifier naming for the same conceptual entity (the milkable interface) will confuse students: the problem and template expect Milkable, the solution uses Dairy, and the solution repository also contains an empty Milkable.java file. Students comparing artifacts or trying to compile the provided solution may be unable to map requirements to the implementation and may face compilation errors.
issues.suggested_fix:
Unify the interface name across all artifacts. Recommended: rename the solution's 'Dairy' interface to 'Milkable' (or change Goat and Seal to implement 'Milkable') and remove or populate the empty Milkable.java so the solution matches the problem/template. Concretely:
- Change Dairy.java to be named Milkable.java and declare 'public interface Milkable { String messageOnMilk(); }'.
- Update Goat.java and Seal.java to 'implements Milkable' instead of 'implements Dairy'.
- Remove any unused/empty duplicate Milkable.java file or ensure only one Milkable interface exists. This aligns the solution to the problem statement and template and prevents student confusion/compilation issues.
